result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Carlos Ramirez Marcelino

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Juan Carlos Ramirez Marcelino in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

2:43 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.
Matter is before the Court for a final pre-trial on file 2015CF000296 and 
status conference on file 2015CM000355.  
Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Carlos Estrada Ramirez in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  
File 2015CF000296 is scheduled for trial before this Court on Monday.  
Both sides are ready to proceed to trial.  
This CM file will continue to track file 2015CF000296.  
Discussion concerning defendant's full name and d.o.b..  
2:53 p.m.  Court in recess.
Minutes filed.

Defendant Juan Carlos Marcelino Ramirez in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes and interpreter Sara Tapia.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Carlos Marcelino Ramirez in court with attorney Travis Schwantes. ADA Valerian Powell  appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is assisted by Spanish interpreter Sarah Tapia. 
Criminal complaint has been received by defendant. Further reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Status hearing scheduled. Matter to track 15CF296.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

*AMENDMENT 08/18/15 TOTAL BOND NOW COVERS CASES 15CF296 & 15GF732*

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH N.C.T. DOB 03/27/2008 OR J.M.T. DOB 09/14/1997 OR THEIR RESIDENCE.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
15-3112, 15-3113 & 15-3182 THRU 15-3185
Defendant in court in custody with Atty Julia May for bond purposes only. Atty A. Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.
